t: Isaiah 49
The Servant, the Light to the Gentiles
“Listen,*pn O coastlands, to Me, And*ld take heed, you peoples from afar! The*ld Lord*s has called Me from the womb; From*ld the matrix of My mother He has made mention of My name.
And*ld He has made My mouth like a sharp sword; In*ld the shadow of His hand He has hidden Me, And*ld made Me a polished shaft; In*ld His quiver He has hidden Me.”
“And*ln He said to me, ‘You*ld are*i My servant, O Israel, In*ld whom I will be glorified.’
Then*ld I said, ‘I have labored in vain, I*ld have spent my strength for nothing and in vain; Yet*ld surely my just reward is*i with the Lord,*s And*ld my work with my God.’”

“And*ln now the Lord*s says, Who*ld formed Me from the womb to*i be*i His Servant, To*ld bring Jacob back to Him, So*ld that Israel is gathered to Him (For*ld I shall be glorious in the eyes of the Lord,*s And*ld My God shall be My strength),

Indeed*ld He says, ‘It*ld is too small a thing that You should be My Servant To*ld raise up the tribes of Jacob, And*ld to restore the preserved ones of Israel; I*ld will also give You as a light to the Gentiles, That*ld You should be My salvation to the ends of the earth.’”

Thus*ln says the Lord,*s The*ld Redeemer of Israel, their Holy One, To*ld Him whom man despises, To*ld Him whom the nation abhors, To*ld the Servant of rulers: “Kings*ld shall see and arise, Princes*ld also shall worship, Because*ld of the Lord*s who is faithful, The*ld Holy One of Israel; And*ld He has chosen You.”

Thus*p says the Lord:*s “In*pn an acceptable time I have heard You, And*ld in the day of salvation I have helped You; I*ld will preserve You and give You As*ld a covenant to the people, To*ld restore the earth, To*ld cause them to inherit the desolate heritages;

That*ld You may say to the prisoners, ‘Go forth,’ To*ld those who are*i in darkness, ‘Show yourselves.’ “They*ln shall feed along the roads, And*ld their pastures shall*i be*i on all desolate heights.
They*ld shall neither hunger nor thirst, Neither*ld heat nor sun shall strike them; For*ld He who has mercy on them will lead them, Even*ld by the springs of water He will guide them.
I*ld will make each of My mountains a road, And*ld My highways shall be elevated.
Surely*ld these shall come from afar; Look!*ld Those from the north and the west, And*ld these from the land of Sinim.”
Sing,*ln O heavens! Be*ld joyful, O earth! And*ld break out in singing, O mountains! For*ld the Lord*s has comforted His people, And*ld will have mercy on His afflicted.
God Will Remember Zion
But*pn Zion said, “The Lord*s has forsaken me, And*ld my Lord has forgotten me.”
“Can*ld a woman forget her nursing child, And*ld not have compassion on the son of her womb? Surely*ld they may forget, Yet*ld I will not forget you.
See,*ld I have inscribed you on the palms of*i My*i hands;*i Your*ld walls are*i continually before Me.
Your*ld sons shall make haste; Your*ld destroyers and those who laid you waste Shall*ld go away from you.

Lift*ld up your eyes, look around and see; All*ld these gather together and*i come to you. As*ild I live,” says the Lord,*s “You*ld shall surely clothe yourselves with them all as an ornament, And*ld bind them on*i you*i as a bride does.*i
“For*ln your waste and desolate places, And*ld the land of your destruction, Will*ld even now be too small for the inhabitants; And*ld those who swallowed you up will be far away.
The*ld children you will have, After*ld you have lost the others, Will*ld say again in your ears, ‘The*ld place is*i too small for me; Give*ld me a place where I may dwell.’

Then*ld you will say in your heart, ‘Who*ld has begotten these for me, Since*ld I have lost my children and am desolate, A*ld captive, and wandering to and fro? And*ld who has brought these up? There*ld I was, left alone; But*ld these, where were*i they?’”

Thus*p says the Lord God:*s “Behold,*pn I will lift My hand in an oath to the nations, And*ld set up My standard for the peoples; They*ld shall bring your sons in their*i arms, And*ld your daughters shall be carried on their*i shoulders;

Kings*ld shall be your foster fathers, And*ld their queens your nursing mothers; They*ld shall bow down to you with their*i faces to the earth, And*ld lick up the dust of your feet. Then*ld you will know that I am*i the Lord,*s For*ld they shall not be ashamed who wait for Me.”
Shall*ln the prey be taken from the mighty, Or*ld the captives of the righteous be delivered?

But*p thus says the Lord:*s “Even*pn the captives of the mighty shall be taken away, And*ld the prey of the terrible be delivered; For*ld I will contend with him who contends with you, And*ld I will save your children.

I*ld will feed those who oppress you with their own flesh, And*ld they shall be drunk with their own blood as with sweet wine. All*ld flesh shall know That*ld I, the Lord,*s am*i your Savior, And*ld your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.”
